items.name: init(mAudioDataBytesCapacity: UInt32, mAudioData: UnsafeMutableRawPointer, mAudioDataByteSize: UInt32, mUserData: UnsafeMutableRawPointer?, mPacketDescriptionCapacity: UInt32, mPacketDescriptions: UnsafeMutablePointer<AudioStreamPacketDescription>?, mPacketDescriptionCount: UInt32)
var mAudioData: UnsafeMutableRawPointer { get }
items.desc: The audio data owned the audio queue buffer. The buffer address cannot be changed.

items.name: var mAudioDataByteSize: UInt32
items.desc: The number of bytes of valid audio data in the audio queue bufferâ€™s mAudioData field, initially set to 0. Your callback must set this value for a playback audio queue; for recording, the recording audio queue sets the value.

items.name: var mAudioDataBytesCapacity: UInt32 { get }
items.desc: The size of the audio queue buffer, in bytes. This size is set when a buffer is allocated and cannot be changed.

items.name: var mPacketDescriptionCapacity: UInt32 { get }
items.desc: The maximum number of packet descriptions that can be stored in the mPacketDescriptions field.

items.name: var mPacketDescriptionCount: UInt32
items.desc: The number of valid packet descriptions in the buffer. You set this value when providing buffers for playback. The audio queue sets this value when returning buffers from a recording queue.

items.name: var mPacketDescriptions: UnsafeMutablePointer<AudioStreamPacketDescription>? { get }
items.desc: An array of AudioStreamPacketDescription structures for the buffer.

items.name: var mUserData: UnsafeMutableRawPointer?
items.desc: The custom data structure you specify, for use by your callback function, when creating a recording or playback audio queue.
